data.title: Food and Service are great!
data.text: I've been coming for years even after the move from across the street. They have the best staff, all with smiles on their faces. The food is plentiful so you wont leave hungry. They have a good thing going for Corona and I hope they stay around for a very long time.

data.title: Three of a Kind
data.text: Dined at 3 of the Hunny's restaurants...Corona, Temescal Valley, and Lake Elsinore. All have great service and great food.  Most of our dining has been in Temescal Valley, where we live.  The prices are reasonable, with great prices for their breakfast & lunch specials. Love their Waffles & Chicken Special. They also have specials on each night of the week. Don't miss their Liver & onions. Yum...Yum!!~!

data.title: Neighborhood Favorite
data.text: This is a basic Family Restaurant, with all the charm and reliability that you would expect.  A few of my favorite dishes are the Chile Verde and Eggs breakfast, Fried Chicken Dinner, and Cinnamon Rolls.

data.title: Good Family Restaurant
data.text: Hunny's is one of those places you go for good home cooked type food. And .. it feels like home. Always consistent, always friendly, always good. Not the best location in terms of in and out, not appealing to the eye from the outside, but never a disappointment from the inside. One of our favorite places to go, when we just want to eat out ... but not feel like we are eating out.

data.title: Great hometown atmosphere!
data.text: I have not been to Hunny's in quite some time, but decided to have lunch there recently and it's as good as I remember it.  If your looking for a spot that gives plenty of food whether it's Breakfast or Lunch (haven't tried Dinner there yet) this is definitely a spot to go.  We love there Hamburgers, soo good!

data.title: Only been here for breakfeast
data.text: If you want a hearty breakfast at a good price, this is your place.  They have a wide menu and service is good.  Much better than Dennys and around the same prices.

data.title: Excellent Service!
data.text: I really liked the old location of Hunny's and since they moved, I really haven't gone very often.  We stopped in with the kids and I enjoyed the food, but I'm writing because of the excellent service that we got.  The waitresses were very friendly, of food came out fairly quickly and the prices were reasonable.

data.title: A long time Corona favorite.
data.text: Expansive old school menu with excellent food. If you've been around Corona for any time, you're almost guaranteed to see friends.

data.title: average all around
data.text: A bit disappointed with the service, Had to wait to be seated even though there were tables available and the hostess or greeter seemed to more interested in conversing with the waiters. It took a bit of prompting for my party of 3 top get seated. Food we average and the sitting is a bit crowded. Will take a big hunger pain to get me back here.

data.title: Go Food!
data.text: Decent Solid Breakfast! Great Food!  Always good no matter what time of day.  They should upgrade their silverware.

data.title: Hunny's
data.text: Wait staff is very friendly, prompt and helpful.  The portion sizes are very large so beware when ordering.  Restaurant itself is not very modern or inviting.

data.title: Don't be afraid
data.text:
I'd rather eat at a family owned place versus a commercial joint, especially for breakfast any day.  Remember you don't go to Denny's. . . . .you end up at Denny's.  

Hunny's For Breakfast was a great choice.  I ate there on early on a Sunday morning, service was great, bacon, eggs, potatoes and toast. Tasty.  Clean, family place, well taken care of, lots of TVs.  If I'm back I'll have to try the fried chicken.  I hear it's good here.

data.title: Honest, Simplefare
data.text: Great place for breakfast - really haven't gone much for lunch or dinner... I love the pigs in a blanket.... Its a very healthy serving.  I did like the older location across the street better, but I still love coming here for breakfast.  Nothing fancy - but the help is friendly and the food is consistent.

data.title: Average
data.text: This restaurant was close to the hotel we were staying in, so we jetted over for a hearty breakfast. My order consisted of three large pancakes, a heap of hashbrowns, a piece of sausage and bacon, and scrambled eggs.  The food was good, but nothing to write home about. The pancakes were a little on the chewy side. My husband felt the same about his food. The service was good -not too overbearing, or neglectful. We definitely got a good amount of food for our money -we didn't leave hungry!  We were seated promptly, and our food was served just as quick.

data.title: Best Breakfast in Corona
data.text: It all starts with great coffee. The breakfast selections are plenty, as well as the portions of food. I have never left hungry and always satisfied with the food.  By the way, the waiters are always pleasant and take good care of you while you are there.

data.title: great american food and pizza
data.text:
At the last minute 12 of us decided to go to dinner. They were
 Up the challenge and handled it beautifully. We all felt the
Food was great and would return. We all have individually
And in smaller groups.

data.title: consistantly sound choice for the hard to find coffee shop
data.text: good food for the low end price points.  I like the ever changing menu.  A safe choice for coffee shop food.

data.title: Great Breakfast Spot
data.text: Hunny's is an old fashioned diner. The food, waitresses and atmosphere take you back to another time. This place excells at breakfast. Even though we live quite far away, we make the drive in to Corona to eat breakfast here. They have everything from traditional eggs, omeletes, pancakes and waffles, to huevos rancheros, eggs benedict and crepes. Portions are big and no matter what your taste (even if you don't love breakfast food like me), you will find something that appeals to you on the menu.

data.title: Good food, good service, comfortable
data.text:
Hunny's has been in Corona for ages, and now is on the east side of Main Street in a pleasant building. The decor is sort of "down-home" with some interesting photos in the entryway. 

My elderly mom and I enjoyed our lunch here. She had the veggie sandwich which had avocado, tomato and I think something else I can't remember. I had a grilled chicken breast sandwich with cream cheese, cranberry, and lettuce on fresh Focacia bread. It was very good! I ate half of it for my lunch then ate the rest of it for breakfast the next day and it was still good :-)

With sandwiches, you have the option of soup, salad, fries, potato salad or fruit. Portions are good sized although I feel the prices are a touch on the high side.

Service was prompt and friendly and the seating is comfortable in an old-fashioned  neighbourhood cafe`style. 

We'll go back :-)

data.title: oso awful
data.text: yikes......the tea and coffee tasted like they had an ashtray dumped in them.  the potatoes were cold and clammy.  the bacon was burnt.  the toast was stale. the service was non-chalant.  I see they have moved across the street, maybe things are better now...at least I sure hope so.
